sense.name: travel by
sense.examples: We are passing the site of that famous Revolutionary War battle. Such an idea would never pass her mind. He passed his professor in the hall. The big gray horse passed the front runner on the inside rail.

sense.name: clear, come through, succeed
sense.examples: Will this amendment pass? The bill has already passed the Senate. She's worried she won't pass the New York Bar exam. The teacher decided to pass the student despite his poor grade on the final exam. This manuscript has passed the scrutiny of three editors.

sense.name: elapse, happen
sense.examples: Time passed and still there was no word from John. The demonstration passed without one violent incident. Many happy childhood summers were passed at the beach. His snide remarks passed without anyone even looking up from their reading.

sense.name: give, transfer
sense.examples: He's passed those files to the department upstairs. The summer house will pass to John and the two cars, to Mary. I tried to pass the ball to Bill, but the dog jumped up and caught it first. The old farm passed back to the state with no heirs to claim it. Could you pass these plates around to the guests?

sense.name: enter a state
sense.examples: She passed into unconsciousness. The fall passed into winter early last year. The old man passed quietly in his sleep.

sense.name: extend
sense.examples: The disputed zoning area passes from the edge of town almost to the airport. The bridge passed over thw widest part of the river.

sense.name: guide, draw through
sense.examples: She passed her fingers over the smooth, green silk fabric. I can't pass thread through a needle without my glasses.

sense.name: communicate
sense.examples: The orders eere passed down the chain of command. I passed a signal to our waiter to bring the check.

sense.name: end, disappear
sense.examples: This, too, will pass. Let's wait until the storm passes. He's taking some medication, but the pain doesn't seem to be passing.

sense.name: exceed
sense.examples: The new kitchen has passed my wildest expectations. The cost of this project is now passing the budget allocated for it.

sense.name: be identified or regarded as
sense.examples: She can sometimes pass for her sister. This margerine will never pass for butter.

sense.name: excrete
sense.examples: Did he finally pass the kidney stone? The dog passed a prune pit.

sense.name: Make a journey from one place to another, travel by, cause to transfer, infiltrate
sense.commentary: Includes: PASS ACROSS, PASS OVER, PASS ON, PASS THROUGH, PASS BY
sense.examples: Their camels were loaded with waterskins, enabling the army to pass across the desert. As glaciers pass over the land they leave distinct features. The travelers pass through the valley of Baca. Pass the chemical through the solution. Pass through an enemy line. A black limo passed by when she looked out the window. Time passes on. The plane passed over Damascus.

sense.name: Communicate, distribute, broadcast
sense.commentary: Includes: PASS ALONG, PASS ON, PASS AROUND, PASS OUT
sense.examples: Pass along the good news! Please pass on this message to anyone you think may be interested. Plenty of blame to pass around. Films filmmakers watch and pass around! The teacher passed out the exams.

sense.name: Die, go out of existance, fade, blow over
sense.examples: She hoped that the problem would eventually pass away. I'm very sorry that she passed away. The pain eventually passed off.

sense.name: Be accepted in false character or identity
sense.examples: She passed off as a Russian agent. She passed the glass off as diamonds.

sense.name: Faint, black out
sense.examples: I bumped my knee, hit my head and passed out.

sense.name: Reject, disregard, fail to acknowledge
sense.examples: He passed me up in the street. Why I passed up the chance to work at Apple. She passed off the insult.

sense.name: Idiomatic Expressions
sense.commentary: Includes: PASS WATER, PASS WITH FLYING COLORS, PASS JUDGEMENT Note: Pass-water is a multi-word expression meaning to urinate Pass_with_flying_colors is a multi-word expression meaning to succeed Pass_judgement is a multi-word expression meaning to criticize or condemn.
sense.examples: Newborn babies pass water frequently. Candidates for the Bar pass with flying colors. It's still too early to pass judgement on revolution.

sense.name: Occur, happen
sense.examples: Elsewhere, the event passed off more smoothly.

sense.name: Emit, expel gas or odors
sense.examples: No examples found

sense.name: Transfer possession, relegate
sense.examples: I am passing on my genes to my children. They can pass on difficult issues to you.

sense.name: Wipe, rub with circular motion
sense.examples: He passes his hands over the soft cloth.

sense.name: Skip
sense.examples: The logic of the Hellenes does not pass over a step of reasoning.
